results.title: Aurelia Steiner
results.brief_description:
Variations on the theme of love messages: the author reads a love letter written by a Jewish girl living in Melbourne while travelling along the Seine.

Credits: Producer, Henry Chapier ; director, Marguerite Duras ; writer, Marguerite Duras ; photography, Eric Dumage, Pierre Lhomme.

results.title: Australia : the great white shark
results.creator_credit: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions
results.brief_description: Aboard the historic trading vessel “The Faile”, acclaimed explorers and film makers Andrew and Liz Wight accompanied by a group of marine scientists, sail south from the Australian mainland to Dangerous Reef. This area is a breeding ground for Australian sea lions and is renowned as being the home to the most dangerous predator in the ocean, the Great White Shark. With an array of planned experiments, including a mobile shark cage, the Wight’s experience and capture on film what is internationally accepted as the most dangerous human interaction with a Great White Shark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions

results.title: Au Coeur de la Vie = in the Heart of Life
results.creator_credit: Robert Enrico, Paul de Roubaix, Robert Hossein and Henry Deutschmeister
results.brief_description:
A dramatization of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, by a series of miracles, to escape death. See also: The story ‘La Riviere de Hibou’ is available separately on 16mm in the NLA Collection (#0087311). See also: Interview with Robert Enrico about this work in ‘Le Desordre et Apres’ (X000659).

Credits: Producers, Henry Deutschmeister, Robert Hossein, Paul de Roubaix ; director, writer, Robert Enrico ; photography, Jean Boffety ; music, Henri Lanoe.
Cast: Roger Jacquet, Anne Cornaly, Anker Larsen.

results.title: Attila
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Giuliano Montaldo, Radiotelevisione Italiana and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the play “Attila, Konig der Hunnen” by Zacharias Werner, this made for television production of the opera “Attila” by Guiseppe Verdi with libretto by Temistocle Solera was performed at the wonderfully atmospheric Arena di Verona in 1985. Set in 5th century A.D. Italy, in the town of Aquileia, during the barbaric age of Huns and Ostrogoths, this opera tells the tale of invasion and victory, love and betrayal, patriotism and vengeance and the eventual fall of the great babarian, Attila the Hun (Evgeny Nesterenko) at the hands of Ezio (Silvano Carroli), Foresto (Veriano Luchetti) and the love who betrayed him, Odabella (Maria Chiara). Featuring the Orchestra and Chorus of the Arena di Verona conducted by Nello Santi, this is a grand-scale production complimented by an impressive stage setting and design, and a very strong cast of lead singers. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Australia : land of the shark
results.creator_credit: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions
results.brief_description: A quest for the truth about the behaviour of the Great White Shark, filmed in the remote waters off the South Australian coast. With an array of planned experiments and special equipment, including a custom built shark ‘sub’ , this film captures a host of extraordinary and sometimes frightening interactions with the king of the ocean.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions

results.title: Attack of the giant leeches
results.creator_credit: Bernard L Kowalski, Gene Corman, Roger Corman and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: After local-moonshine swilling trapper Lem Sawyer (George Cisar) sees a giant creature, people start disappearing. While searching for illegal traps Steve Benton (Ken Clark) and girl friend Nan Greyson (Jan Shepard) find Lem dying with giant sucker wounds on his body. One couple, Liz Walker (Yvette Vickers) and Cal Moulton (Michael Emmett), forced into the water by her enraged husband Dave Walker (Bruno Ve Sota), get taken by the leeches. When police refuse to believe Dave’s story, he hangs himself. Soon after this, two more trappers disappear, and local Game Warden Steve Benton gets involved. He and Nan’s father - Dr Greyson, realize that the people were taken by the leeches and the leeches live in caves under the swamp. Using dynamite, the four missing bodies are discovered, but are the leeches destroyed? Written By Leo Gordon, with music by Alexander Laszlo.

results.title: Australia's wheat
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, John Gray, Heinz Fenke, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an outline of the Australian wheat industry, a brief history and general view of growing, harvesting, bulk handling and processing, research and marketing. Shows the industry from the historical beginnings at Experiment Farm and the growing colony of New South Wales, to mechanical innovation, nationwide research and modern transport and handling. Explains the farmer’s work through each season and traces the marketing of the grain from the country silo to the consumers overseas.

results.title: Attack Force Z
results.brief_description: Hidden on a small Pacific Island is a man with a secret that could end the Second World War and the killer elite Attack Force Z is sent in to get him out… or die in the attempt.

results.title: Atonement
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, George Pearson, Canadian Wildlife Service and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ten million buffalo once roamed the plains of North America but now, only a few carefully protected herds remain. The carrier pigeon, the whooping crane and other species have fallen prey to the greatest predator, man. This program shows efforts by wildlife specialists to preserve and nurture the creatures that remain in the wilderness areas. Scenes rarely photographed are included in this spellbinding documentary.

results.title: Atomisation
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Atomisation is defined as the breaking up of liquids into minute drops for efficient burning or economical spreading. Different methods of atomising liquids; scent spray; centrifugal spinning cup plus air blast; pressure jet. Slowed movement illustrations (150X) show how atomisation occurs. Main uses: agricultural and for burning liquid fuel. Various methods of qualitative and quantitative evaluation of spray patterns. Testing jet aircraft atomizers.
